thread.title: ‘Somm’ follow-up to open Napa Valley Film Fest
thread.title_full: ‘Somm’ follow-up to open Napa Valley Film Fest - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Christine Delsol
title: ‘Somm’ follow-up to open Napa Valley Film Fest
text:
Photo: Napa Valley Film Festival The Napa Valley Film Festival, opening with Jason Wise’s follow-up to “Somm,” will have as much wine and food in the venues as on the screen in “Somm: Into the Bottle.” The Napa Valley Film Festival, opening with Jason Wise’s...
The opening-night film for the 2015 Napa Valley Film Festival, appropriately enough, will be the world premiere of “Somm: Into the Bottle.” Jason Wise’s follow-up to 2013’s acclaimed “Somm” looks into the lives of some of the world’s most accomplished sommeliers and winemakers, while delving into the ways history has shaped the wine available today. The five-day festival will screen 125 new independent films and host 150 wineries and 30 chefs along with the actors and filmmakers — all the better to staff food demonstrations and wine tastings. The Napa Valley Film Festival, opening with Jason Wise’s follow-up to “Somm,” will have as much wine and food in the venues as on the screen in “Somm: Into the Bottle.” The Napa Valley Film Festival, opening with Jason Wise’s...
The opening-night film for the 2015 Napa Valley Film Festival, appropriately enough, will be the world premiere of “Somm: Into the Bottle.” Jason Wise’s follow-up to 2013’s acclaimed “Somm” looks into the lives of some of the world’s most accomplished sommeliers and winemakers, while delving into the ways history has shaped the wine available today. The five-day festival will screen 125 new independent films and host 150 wineries and 30 chefs along with the actors and filmmakers — all the better to staff food demonstrations and wine tastings.
